track.title: Rey
track.creator: The Sharp Things
track.annotation: Just in time for summer, here's a sunny track from the new Sharp Things album! This is dedicated to everyone who's escaped the suburbs with their creative vision intact! "A Moveable Feast" will be released June 26, 2007, on Bar/None Records.

track.title: Sufle Leben
track.creator: The Unnecessary Revolution
track.annotation: The Unnecessary Revolution (1991-2004) decided to release their last album as a netalbum only. following a decade of giving their music to record labels and not getting it back. This Track is from their first net e.p. "1st of 3" (birdsong010 2005)

track.title: live_on_the_product
track.creator: marfil
track.annotation:
electro production on live
extract live set on bergamo

track.title: acclimate
track.creator: general fuzz
track.annotation: lush melodic instrumental electronica. This track features JP Cutler and Adam Blomberg on guitar, and Jason Parmar on Tabla. More CC music available on my website: www.generalfuzz.net

track.title: Avanti
track.creator: Cixxx J
track.annotation: A mixture of dub, idm, jazzy sturdy epianos and noises and feedbacks from no known places.

track.title: intersection

track.annotation:
WHAT: yes.no.yes
WHERE: boston, MA
WHEN: summer of '05 - summer of '06
STATUS: hiatus
SOUNDS LIKE: experiments in layered noise, lo-fi, abrasive guitars, bare bones, feedback, melodic and discordant, loud, ramshackle

track.title: Beggars
track.creator: Madcab
track.annotation: “With dense and heavy atmospheres lead by a powerful percussion section, electrifying guitar riffs and prevailing and guttural voices, Madcab deliver us Keeping Wounds Open, where they combine rock tunes with late 90's heavy metal scene.”

track.title: Vai Com A Chuva
track.creator: Azevedo Silva
track.annotation: “One again, a close encouter with slow paced, melancholic, lo-fi, acoustic and intimate music all sung so beautifully in Portuguese. Tartaruga is an album that breathes sadness, loss, hope and saudade...”

track.title: moderndayknight
track.creator: yes.no.yes.
track.annotation:
WHAT: yes.no.yes
WHERE: boston, MA
WHEN: summer of '05 - summer of '06
STATUS: hiatus
SOUNDS LIKE: experiments in layered noise, lo-fi, abrasive guitars, bare bones, feedback, melodic and discordant, loud, ramshackle

INFLUENCES: sonic youth, blonde redhead, fugazi, hum, radiohead, mogwai, pinback, sunny day real estate

track.title: Untitled 01
track.creator: Noi
track.annotation: This is perhaps the most mystical and deep work of all the I have realized. An approach to the most classic ambient; a work of contrasts with certain sweet and sour touch, and always trying to support the emotivity in his highest point. In this case, the use of oscillators of low and high frequencies is the starting point in a semi-aleatory succession using simultaneously different field recordings to offer a proper and personal meaning to every cut. The repetition and the disorder coexist deliberately to reflect and to transmit simultaneously the reality of the life itself in four tracks that work in session or individually. Indicated for moments of abstraction and isolation.

track.title: My Planet
track.creator: Lark Wiskey
track.annotation: Lark Wiskey is a cosmic being that manifest itself in many evolutionary planets, mainly at critical moments, like these our Earth is passing through - a moment of transition. At these moments, when the five senses are not enough to express the life, anguish and anxiety take possession of the afflicted hearts, the humanity needs help. We are not alone. Lark is a being, an energy, on to the arts, in special to music, because music is the language of Muses, the language of Gods, that can be noticed even at the first steps of evolution, even by the irrationals animals. Its origin, not known, seems that it followed the exodus of Capella. Lark is adimensional and therefore its presence makes itself to be feeling through composers, musicians and interpreters spread out the universe. Of all places... to thousands, already said the king. Its communication is subtil, what it makes it difficult many times to identify the origin of the received material. At this moment some artists are receiving the mission to manisfest the musical art of Lark, cosmic and liberating. The only intention of Lark Wiskey is to divulge and promove the Love. The true essence of the Ksmos, and to prepare the humanity for the new conscience, spiritual. Lark Wiskey does not need aid. We do need it! Peace be with you. Thus either!

track.title: Wheat
track.creator: Uncle Owen Aunt Beru
track.annotation: Uncle Owen Aunt Beru is the experimental/ambient/folk project of Jessica Calleiro, who "makes music like journal entries." She claims to never practice or remember her songs, which gives them their unrefined, spur-of-the-moment air. Wheat is part the her free album Spaces in time

track.title: sailing on right by
track.creator: hot bitch arsenal
track.annotation:
think of steampunk dirigibles while you listen to this one.
the future beckons, and it is sad.

track.title: Girls With The Glasses
track.creator: Ryan Smith
track.annotation: This is the latest single. For info on shows dates and more, go to www.ryansmithonline.com .

track.title: Juan Manuel Fangio
track.creator: Daniele Torelli
track.annotation:
A cheerful pseudo-rock song dedicated to the first formula one legend, featuring the beautiful "glam" voice of Alice Borciani. The whole "Logical Human Race" album, a concept about car races, can be found here .
Warning! funny english pronounciation:)

track.title: Springbling Netlabel Mix [swm020]
track.creator: Matthias Heiderich
track.annotation: Springtime inspired German DJ and netlabel artist Matthias Heiderich aka Massju to create this minimal and dancable netlabel mix.

track.title: Aufenthaltsberechtigungsschein (Endlich ist der Sommer da)
track.creator: Bernhard
track.annotation: A homegrown Punkrock-Song with a little bit Surf-Feeling and German Lyrics. The Text deals with the Summer in Hamburg / Germany and the Desire for living in a sunny place like e.g. California. I'm still looking for a Drummer and a Keyboarder to record this one with a "real" band.

track.title: Interpunctiones
track.creator: Ensemble Phase 3
track.annotation: This is the first track the album. Great classical/experimental improvised music by the german Ensemble Phase 3.

track.title: An Ocean Part Deux
track.creator: The Sharp Things
track.annotation: Featuring the 40-piece New York Symphonic Arts Ensemble, this song is on The Sharp Things' new album, "A Moveable Feast", which comes out June 26, 2007, on Bar/None Records . Stream the entire album now at thesharpthings.com

track.title: Gamin
track.creator: Nippercreep
track.annotation: Track from Split CD Nippercreep/The Warblinkers. A thrash punk song!!!!

track.title: Darkness
track.creator: Legion
track.annotation:
"...I allowed my friend Edgeist to listen to some of these samples, and he was like "dude, you've got everything you need to start an album". I followed his words, and started to work on the thing. A few days later, "Scorched Earth" and "Haunted Cathedral" were born. Once again, Edgeist was very enthusiastic, so I kept working, and other tracks were born. Then time passed, I created a few more tracks, and reworked most of the first tracks, sometimes very deeply ("Haunted Cathedral", which ultimatly turned into a remix of one of Edgeist's piece of music, has now almost nothing similar with the 2005 original version)."
L'etoil du matin noir is dark, ambient, a soundtrack for the obscure. Great album, so thanks Edgeist for encouraging Legion to create this album.

track.title: Emotion
track.creator: Sinapsya
track.annotation: Sadness happens to the best of us and sometimes a shoulder to cry on just isn't enough. Feeling sorry for yourself is a full-time occupation and the only way to do it properly is to give free rein to your emotions with a suitable soundtrack that can reflect what you are feeling inside. Whenever I want to engage in the odd spot of sentimental wallowing, the bittersweet and melancholic tunes of Sinapsya provide the kind of soothing aural bath I need. That the track Emotion was partly composed on a computer in no way detracts from the overall warmth the tune conveys. I highly recommend it to even the most electrophobic amongst you: those who are still convinced that digital music is exclusively tied to the realm of washing machines, sweaty-rave parties or your kid's walkman. Call it 'downtempo electro', laptop folk', or whatever you wish - click on the icon on your desktop, unzip the file and download the soooouunds of Sinapsya...

track.title: Mit an Sicherheit grenzender Wahrscheinlichkeit
track.creator: The Crusty Crap
track.annotation: The band "The Crusty Crap" consists of the members Jazzy James (aka Jazza), Mister HIV, Dry Don, Pretty Milly (aka Milles) and MC Harry Balls. It's the first German Grime Group and their music is very Drum 'n Bass influenced.

track.title: Life Is A Movie Theater With Lots Of Laughter
track.creator: Riyu Konaka
track.annotation: A Japanese artist who spent most of her childhood in the U.S. She writes avan-guarde Fake Jazz Pop and performs poetry with a variety of themes which she writes with poet + producer, Bun Onoe, with a acrobatic vocal style. She recorded many albums with musicians in the N.Y. Underground scene, such as Medeski, Martin and Wood, Marc Ribot, Peter Scherer, Bill Ware and Roy Nathanson.

track.title: Arabeat
track.creator: AP:MP
track.annotation: Arabeat is a mish mash of hard and broken electronic beats, arabic pop and braindance all soaked in punk attitude. Produced by Digital_Me as part of the AP:MP E.P. for free download through http://birdsong.co.il

track.title: Susplended
track.creator: Karl-Johan Nilsson
track.annotation: A sweet little melody and lots of experimental fun in this well done IDM track.. Repetition in non-repetitive forms or something to that sort. Regardless.. a very nice song.

track.title: Exp 4
track.creator: Cixxx J
track.annotation: Nu Electro / Breakbeat stormer fulfilled with Detroit influences. Machinery meet Machines. -Podsafe! as always-

track.title: Your wish is my command
track.creator: Lark Wiskey
track.annotation: Lark Wiskey is a cosmic being that manifest itself in many evolutionary planets, mainly at critical moments, like these our Earth is passing through - a moment of transition. At these moments, when the five senses are not enough to express the life, anguish and anxiety take possession of the afflicted hearts, the humanity needs help. We are not alone. Lark is a being, an energy, on to the arts, in special to music, because music is the language of Muses, the language of Gods, that can be noticed even at the first steps of evolution, even by the irrationals animals. Its origin, not known, seems that it followed the exodus of Capella. Lark is adimensional and therefore its presence makes itself to be feeling through composers, musicians and interpreters spread out the universe. Of all places... to thousands, already said the king. Its communication is subtil, what it makes it difficult many times to identify the origin of the received material. At this moment some artists are receiving the mission to manisfest the musical art of Lark, cosmic and liberating. The only intention of Lark Wiskey is to divulge and promove the Love. The true essence of the Ksmos, and to prepare the humanity for the new conscience, spiritual. Lark Wiskey does not need aid. We do need it! Peace be with you. Thus either!

track.title: El Illegal
track.creator: Musica Maestro
track.annotation: Attention all the exploited immigrant masses! The theme of this Track of the Week will be painfully familiar to many of you, whether Bulgarian builder or Mexican orange-picker. Listen, as Sergio and Dolores Martinez of Musica Maestro bemoan the plight of the poor immigrant who is deemed "un caso ilegal", just because "vengo a trabajar" ('I come to work'). With a chirpy accordion and an irresistible bass rhythm offsetting the plaintive vocal melody, this boisterous lament exemplifies the Mexican group's success in bringing the original sound of their country up to date without detracting from its integrity. Sadly, this may be the best that today's beleaguered immigrants can hope for, at least until the Revolution comes.

track.title: Photophobia
track.creator: Kudu
track.annotation: A minimalistic DJ netlabel mix by Kudu from Russia.

track.title: The Godfather II - End Titles
track.creator: Daniel Bautista
track.annotation: Part of the soundtrack of The Godfather II, rearranged for drums, bass and various guitars. Recorded in a Gentoo Linux box.

track.title: Chemistry
track.creator: The Sugar People
track.annotation: After a lifetime of listening to cutting-edge experimental underground tunes, I can no longer hide the fact that my tastes have wandered into the realm of poppy, catchy and, yes, sleazy music! Who would have ever thought it? After listening to The Sugar People's track, Chemistry, you will understand why I have taken you with me down this bootylicious path. Slinking their way through the sexiest sounds of the '70s on this steamy number, the Sugars demonstrate their faultless funk-rock credentials with what sounds like a cameo from Barry White as an added bonus!

track.title: Blow out the Sound feat: Leslie Helpbert
track.creator: Heavy Mojo
track.annotation: You don't have to be a hiphopper, a metaller or a funkateer to see that Heavy Mojo (of Atlanta, Georgia) are headed for the big time. With the huge vocal presence of their charismatic frontmen (Priest Shoobie, B Dirty & Simon Temple) belted and crooned over the top of a stomping honky backing band, the Mojos rock any stereo, any arena. Blow out the Sound feat: Leslie Helpbert, allows us to sample some of their more populist tendencies while appreciating their combined vocal range. The band drop a rather laid-back track unlike the trademark full-frontal assault that characterises some of the more explosive songs on the album, just giving us little teasing tasters of what is to come...

track.title: Plaster Saint
track.creator: Shearer
track.annotation: Great Kick Ass Punk'n'Roll from Germany's capitol. Visit http://www.shearer.de/ for the free album download.

track.title: Futuristic Japanese hellriders from outer space
track.creator: SxFxTxC
track.annotation: SxFxTxC (Shmen For The Children) are a four-piece hardcore punk group. The band started playing together in the summer of 2004 when they were all staying in Berlin. "Futuristic Japanese hellriders from outer space" is a track from the E.P "God Bless SxFxTxC" for free download through birdsong netlabel.

track.title: Photogenic Memory
track.creator: miQue
track.annotation: Prepare to be astonished by miQue: “category defying, genre bending poptropica” (and that’s how just he defines it himself!). Photogenic memory lulls you into a false sense of (in)security, making you believe you are listening to a wacky electro breakbeat tune, totally unaware that you are about to be thrust into a funky poptastic dimension. Weird? - yes; but somehow strangely ecstatic at the same time. It’s probably just best if you listen for yourself.....

track.title: Death Fish
track.creator: Cixxx J
track.annotation: CC 2.5 by-nc-sa. Plenty of guitars mixed up with new skool breaks and blowing experimentalish noises. Bang your head to this tune

track.title: French Toast
track.creator: Foley
track.annotation:
"Mmm... it reminds me of the tropical bar scene from that Bond film". "Which Bond film?" You know, that Bond film. The one with the lady in a bikini" "Oh, I see" "Well I suppose anything is better than sitting in my office in London, looking at the sunny, but freezing, day through my large and sooty windows" "Exactly"
I imagine that Foley (three British musicians from the not-so-sunny town of Gravesend, UK) would be happy to have their music described in such warm and cinematic terms.
"Now where's that bloody waiter?"

track.title: Other Way down
track.creator: The Dots
track.annotation: The Dots - finest british Garage Pop from Dresden / Germany. Now releasing their first full-length album @ http://www.digitalkunstrasen.net.
track.album: fashion for the dressed and naked

track.title: double down quick, you show me the way, all along the chilltower (live @ red square, albany, ny)
track.creator: hot bitch arsenal
track.annotation: we're back with a live set from the last bit of our show @ the red square (not in moscow, but in albany, ny). featuring 'double down quick', 'you show me the way', and 'all along the chilltower' (a previous cc-hit). recorded new year's eve, 12/31/2006.

track.title: Light Years
track.creator: Tripp Bratton - Catawampus Universe
track.annotation: One of Tripp's compositions featured on the Catawampus Universe double CD Dragon Whips its Tail released in 2001. Light Years Features an exotic synth melody over an inside-out groove. For more, visit the overtone.com podcast
track.album: Catawampus Universe - Dragon Whips its Tail

track.title: SomePlaceNew
track.creator: Uncle Owen Aunt Beru
track.annotation: The last track from Spaces in time . A new full length album by Uncle Owen Aunt Beru for free download.

track.title: Netcandy Volume 2 - Let's Break
track.creator: Harald Walker
track.annotation: A netlabel DJ mix with hip-hop and other breakbeat styles with vocals as well as instrumental. The mix starts with a beautiful track by Playme which is sung in Rumantsch, a language only being spoken by about 50,000-70,000 people in the canton of Graubünden in Switzerland. Other raps are in English, German and Spanish.

track.title: Sea Scent
track.creator: Tape Tum
track.annotation: Tape Tum are Lieven Dousselaere (guitar, voice, electronics) and Benjamin Dousselaere (bass, voice and electronics), two belgian brothers that work togheter in this band.

track.title: Origins Suite - Dance of Emergence
track.creator: Tripp Bratton
track.annotation: Here is a moody exotic percussion based excerpt from a longer work. This section is influenced by Balinese Gamelon music and other Asian and Persian styles but mixed with a modern aesthetic. Originally commissioned for dance.

track.title: Ten Long Months
track.creator: DrNI
track.annotation: A clumsy piece about a cumbersome time, different from the others on the album "Constant Change"

track.title: I Dream of You
track.creator: DrNI
track.annotation: Trance-style track from the free album "Constant Change".

track.title: Memorizando el futuro [swm015]
track.creator: Il Vitro
track.annotation: A 31 minute long techouse netlabel mix by Il Vitro from Mexico.

track.title: B
track.creator: Ofir
track.annotation: the 2nd track from "Hey you, come here" by Ofir. birdsong 2005

track.creator: Marfil
track.annotation:
Electro Marfil Style Sou nd
THis is Free Musicccc

track.title: Lost Hour
track.creator: Thoth (aka Natezomby)
track.annotation: A strange instrumental trip-hop deal full of twists that goes in perhaps too many ways at once, composed by a serious depressive who has been in and out of mental hospitals and has a penchant for sound collage. The title is based on the paranormal phenomenon known as " lost time ", and similar mysterious disappearances where people go missing without a trace (I hope there are logical explanations). The title is a tribute to an episode on this subject done on the cult hit tv show "Eerie, Indiana" from the early 90's. The composer really is insane (Seriously).

track.title: Transição (Transition)
track.creator: NeLaS
track.annotation: This tracks is an electronic experiment by NeLaS. It contains a different fusion of influences and rhythms that includes brazilian music, drum'n'bass and idm.

track.title: 17 reasons to play minimal [swm014]
track.creator: cHMa
track.annotation: In the Sonic Walker Mix #14 cHMa presents a minimalistic live DJ netlabel mix recorded in Coacalco Mexico, including electronic music from Mexican artists like Miguel Gonzales and excellent Mexican labels like Filtro and Discos Konfort.

track.title: Party Boy
track.creator: Jackass
track.annotation: Party Boy Song

track.title: Echo's Answer
track.creator: Butterbox
track.annotation: Echo's Answer (kpu096)

track.title: Dummy
track.creator: Shearer
track.annotation:
Berlin Kick Ass Rock. Album for free Download on shearer.de .
A few excerpts from a recent review (Warschauer no 53): "14 Punk-Rock'n'Roll-Hits - no blackouts [...] Hallmark are the catchy melodies and the expressive voice [...] I believe you'll here a lot of them in the future."
Enjoy!

track.title: Premier Verset
track.creator: Muhr
track.annotation: Muhr, as featured on numerous other labels in the ethosphere, arrives on Kahvi at last. Otherwise known as Kahvi veteran Vizion, has produced an entirely different style and persona to go with the alternative artist name Muhr - subtle, minimal, ambient, emotional. All the ingredients for the usual Introspective release but with a Canadian twist of ice. Some lovely work in this release, so do the man a favour and leave some feedback!

track.title: Holkop Max
track.creator: Blamstrain
track.annotation: `ve been forced to break Kahvi's unwritten rule. The no vocals policy has gone out the window, but its for a good reason. Blamstrain is back for a guest appearance of such quality (and oddity) that I couldn't really 'not' release this ep. Exobo (verging on the vocal house but with a serious IDM edge) to Saleet. Some lovely ideas, effects and production make this curious evolution from previous Blamstrain releases one for the collection. Dont forget to check out Blamstrains new release on sendingorbs.com - Disfold as well as a collaboration ep with Mr. Brothomstates himself on Narita.

track.title: Invisible
track.creator: Alexey V
track.annotation: hollow and atmospheric leading to fast and melodic. icy edge, well produced and good solid percussion. perhaps not one to chill to but one to groove to.

track.title: My favorite kind of silence
track.creator: Xerxes
track.annotation: bang up to date, a seriously impressive piece of ambient composition. everything is in this track from the emotive melodies and fantastic percussion to the ambient pads and chords that we at kahvi are such fans of. great great track.

track.title: Chamber of Mirrors
track.creator: Krusseldorf
track.annotation: a guest release from krusseldorf, nice atmospheres created from this introduction to the ep. addictive melodies, chilled with a subtle groove throughout. one of my personal faves from this release.

track.title: Dispehrse
track.creator: ESEM
track.annotation: whats this? a simple beginning - but this it fooling you. let the track run and you`ll find the analogue warmth, the beat begins, the track takes off. hunting high and low, wide and narrow - a nice piece masterfully created.

track.title: b~ckbook
track.creator: ESEM
track.annotation: a slow and subtle building start to the ep courtest of b~ckbook. within the intricacies of the curious background percussion a gentle sweeping melody appears - leading into a suitable esem rhythm and melody. aahhhh.

track.title: Away
track.creator: Bog
track.annotation: Away

track.title: Get Some Rock&Roll (Tonite)
track.creator: Electric Fence
track.annotation: HardRock with influences AC/DC, Black Crowes, Kiss...

track.title: peace
track.creator: in-sist
track.annotation: another party track with the latin taste from Japanese hiphop band, In-sist.

track.title: AFTER GIRL
track.creator: Riyu Konaka
track.annotation: A Japanese who spent most of her childhood in the U.S. She writes polygonal After Jazz-pop and performs poetry of various themes.

track.title: Needle Pleasure
track.creator: Krabatof Philharmonic Orchestra
track.annotation: A dark ambient track with a very low frequency textured landscape.

track.title: Ocean
track.creator: Avi Abrams
track.annotation: instrumental with a strong melodic line, in ELO style, check out the rest at http://www.thrillingwondermusic.blogspot.com

track.title: Paradise (... is here with me)
track.creator: Marc Ashmann & Mary Bookwood
track.annotation:
A song from the perspective of a woman in Palestine, who see´s no future in suicide-bombings ... (lyrics included - visible in itunes)
Time: 4:49

track.title: In the sink - remix
track.creator: Beatmapper
track.annotation: Beatmapper remix to Tiny Creature's "In the sink" from the Birdsong remixes webalbum .

track.title: Kids
track.creator: DJ Drinks
track.annotation: Hip Hop instrumental, lost and found phrases and measures blended together like you favorite margarita.

track.title: blade runner
track.creator: asagaz and rifhes
track.annotation: Asagaz and Rifhes from TECHKILLA recordings comes in with this heavy futuristic tech-step track.

track.title: Queda Te (Ringheims Auto remiks)
track.creator: Combo Candombe
track.annotation: Latino track with lots of hiphop flavour added to it.

track.title: Union de Deux Ames
track.creator: Delicieux
track.annotation: French hip hop poetry for lyrical lovers over organic analouge beats from the kitchen. Nice for your earhole.

track.title: Symphony No. 25 arranged for electric guitars
track.creator: Daniel Bautista
track.annotation: The 1st movement of the Mozart's Symphony No. 25 performed by Daniel Bautista (www.danielbautista.com), guitarist of Ciruelo Cilindrico (www.ciruelocilindrico.com).

track.title: failure (nebulae's lament remix)
track.creator: hot bitch arsenal
track.annotation:
i've had my moneypenny forever, she's kind of a basic model, perhaps a bit stodgy, but (to me) quite the hot bitch nonetheless.
nebulae went all out when he configured his, he got all the options, plus the custom lara croft coachwork and the max-sass rom module.
i imagine their checklist going something like this: nebulae: (sauve) sick beats? moneypenny: (sultry) check. nebulae: (idly flicking a mote of dust from his lapel) majestic strings? moneypenny: (adjusting her thigh holster) check. nebulae: (thanking the fsm for thigh holsters) boldly cinematic in scope? moneypenny: (over her sunglasses) most assuredly. nebulae: (suddenly concerned) proper bits of delay throughout? moneypenny: (calmly) check. nebulae: (insouciantly) shall we render then, miss moneypenny? moneypenny: (unbuttoning, pressing [ctrl]-[shift]-r) absolutely. rendering at 32 bits, 44,100 kilohertz.
the 'nebulae's lament remix' of 'failure' is here .
listen loud, on decent speakers or with good headphones. trust me. unbelievable production, majestic just begins to describe it (the strings!), christina's vox is lovingly layered throughout, she is at the top of her form.

track.title: amazup melody
track.creator: mariko fujii
track.annotation: a female guitarist (ex. super egg machine) , japanese pops.

track.title: Tattoo (Her Highness orchestremix)
track.creator: Beatmapper
track.annotation: Beatmapper remix to Her Highness's "Tattoo" from "Major Keez joind by Her Highness In the Neither Land e.p." as part of the new Birdsong remixes album.

track.title: All my best friends are metalheads
track.creator: Less than Jake
track.annotation: All my best friends are metalheads. A song about how prejudiced is wrong and how everyone should have the same rights and freedom.

track.title: Perfect Noise

track.annotation: http://www.paulosacramento.com.br/blog/?page_id=180

track.annotation: Japanese female newage artist with elegant and sweet melody. It's her new song. music video is at http://blip.tv/file/71416

track.title: Rock'n'Roll
track.creator: Shearer
track.annotation: Enjoy! If you like that song, visit www.shearer.de for the free album download!

track.title: Brad Sucks - Dirtbag (Blackberry's Dirtbeat Remix)
track.creator: Blackberry
track.annotation:
Here comes the incredible dirty Dirtbeat-Remix of Brad Sucks’ Dirtbag from Blackberry. Feel free to pump up the volume and let your feets entertain from this just for fun freakbeat remake. It’s nasty, fast and very dirrrrty! So - don’t take it too serious!
www.bradsucks.net www.blackberry-music.net
